artist: Designer: George Washington Maher; Manufacturer: Gorham Manufacturing Company; Retailer: Spaulding & Company, Chicago, Illinois
creditline: Gift of funds from the Decorative Arts Council with proceeds from the 2005 Antiques Show and Sale
description: gold-washed tines, silver handle; rounded head with tapering tines; handle decorated with long-stemmed lilies with two flowers and two buds and EKG monogram
markings: on back of handle, stamped: [SPAULDING & CO. CHICAGO]; on one side of handle, stamped:[Martelé (lion) (anchor) G (?)]; on opposite side of handle, stamped: [9584]
object_name: Dessert fork, from a twelve-piece place setting
portfolio: From Designed for Rockledge, the E. L. King House, Homer, MN (demolished 1987)
title: Dessert fork, from a twelve-piece place setting
